alert.note: Alert for Clarke (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 05 at 7:59AM CDT until April 05 at 8:45AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM CDT FOR NORTHERN CLARKE AND EASTERN LAUDERDALE COUNTIES... At 759 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Tamola to near Quitman, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Lauderdale around 805 AM CDT. Snell around 815 AM CDT. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for east central Mississippi. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
